contextId.information: the name of a city (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
grieving because the false god Tammuz had died (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah

contextId.information: This is the name of a man. Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:11:01|11:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a woman that means "my tent is in her." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"I will make all of Edom ... from Teman to Dedan." These are two cities at opposite ends of Edom. This means that Yahweh will destroy all of Edom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: I will make them ... from Teman to Dedan

contextId.information: "The people of Chereth." This is a people that lived in the city of Chereth in Philistia. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a small island off the coast of Syria. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a city on the Syrian coast. Other versions call it by the name "Gebal." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_textvariants]])
This is the name of a coastal region also known as Ionia. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These were the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Dan ... Javan ... Uzzal ... Dedan ... Arabia ... Kedar

contextId.information: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Sheba ... Raamah ... Haran ... Canneh ... Eden ... Sheba ... Asshur ... Kilmad

contextId.information: This the name of a town in southern Egypt. It is now called Aswan. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These borders of Cush were south of Syene. Some versions say Sudan or Ethiopia, the modern names of countries south of Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Libya is a country west of Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Memphis was a very important city in Egypt. It was near modern-day Cairo. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These were cities in northern Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a leader or king who ruled in the land of Magog. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This name means "Great Army." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
names of towns (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Hethlon ... Zedad ... Berothah ... Sibraim ... Hazer Hatticon ... Hauran ... Hazar Enan

contextId.information: town names (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
names of towns. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:47:18|47:19]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
